intro: Seseli verticillatum, commonly known as mountain sesame, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its flowers bloom in late summer, and it produces small, round fruits that contain numerous seeds. Seseli verticillatum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
